subject: RE: [junit] @BeforeClass vs static{} (JUnit 4+ only)
msgSnippet: ... @BeforeClass runs everytime the tests are (re)run, a static initializer only once when the class is loaded. That would make a significant difference to a
messageBody:
junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:
> Hi all, quick question: can someone enlighten me to the
> benefits of using @BeforeClass vs
> using a static{} constructor for my test classes? Actually,
> I suspect there are reasons to be
> using both, but I haven't really found any convincing cases
> yet for code to go into one over
> the other.

@BeforeClass runs everytime the tests are (re)run, a static initializer only
once when the class is loaded. That would make a significant difference to a
test runner that reruns tests using the same classloader.

Cheers, Ilja
